feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculator" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 8 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 6 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: Discrepancy in unpaid leave deduction calculation when salary configurations change
findings.issue_explanation: System failed to automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission, resulting in incorrect payroll deductions
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot dynamically update pending leave deductions when salary configurations change after leave request creation
findings.gap_statement: Lacks automatic synchronization between salary configuration changes and existing leave deduction calculations

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) pro-rated amount calculation produces consistently slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors
findings.issue_explanation: When calculating daily wage for pro-rated End of Service amounts, the system shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimal points, affecting all employees regardless of departure date
findings.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculation (basic + allowances / 30) has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts
findings.gap_statement: The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations

findings.group_description: Platform uses a fixed daily wage calculation method that cannot be customized across different organizational requirements
findings.issue_explanation: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which does not align with all client calculation preferences
findings.limitation_statement: The platform cannot modify the daily wage calculation method or use alternative formulas like (Basic Salary × 12 / 365)
findings.gap_statement: No flexibility exists to configure alternative daily wage computation methods

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator has independent configurations for leave salary and salary proration, causing potential calculation discrepancies.
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage configurations with separate divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), leading to inconsistent calculations.
findings.limitation_statement: The platform cannot automatically align leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations without manual configuration.
findings.gap_statement: There is no unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

findings.group_description: Misunderstanding about how daily wage calculator prorates salary based on working days configuration
findings.issue_explanation: User initially believed salary was not prorating correctly, but investigation revealed the system was calculating based on the employee's work week configuration where all 7 days were marked as working days
findings.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not align with typical weekend expectations

findings.group_description: Synchronization issue between Time Off and Payroll modules when calculating daily wage during unpaid leave with public holiday changes
findings.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between HR and Payroll systems, resulting in incorrect salary deductions
findings.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holiday configurations change after leave request creation
findings.gap_statement: Need for real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculation for unpaid leave uses a non-standard divisor that can produce deduction amounts differing from user expectations
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can result in deduction amounts that exceed the expected monthly salary
findings.limitation_statement: The payroll system calculates daily wage using a fixed 30.42-day divisor, which may not align with user expectations of precise monthly salary deductions
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed monthly salary amounts

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculator displays incorrect remarks for unpaid leave deduction, showing 31 days instead of the actual calendar days for the month (e.g., 29 days in February).
findings.issue_explanation: While the underlying calculation remains mathematically correct, the remarks field shows an incorrect number of days for daily rate computation, potentially causing user confusion.
findings.limitation_statement: The system's remarks display does not dynamically adjust to the actual number of calendar days in each month.
findings.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate remarks based on the actual days in each month.

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual intervention required when daily wage calculation is affected by public holiday timing
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Create a manual deduction to correct the salary deduction when automatic calculation is incorrect

troubleshooting.group_description: When discrepancies arise in daily wage or gratuity calculations, manual cross-checking is recommended
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify calculation by breaking down days worked, applying fixed divisor, and comparing platform results

troubleshooting.group_description: Users need to manually verify and align daily wage configurations for leave salary and salary proration to ensure consistent calculations.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually check and configure both leave salary and salary proration daily wage settings to use the same divisor and calculation method.

troubleshooting.group_description: Verify work week settings to understand daily wage proration calculation
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's work week configuration to confirm how working days are defined, especially in cases with non-standard work weeks

troubleshooting.group_description: How to calculate unpaid leave deductions using the system's configured daily wage divisor
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: To calculate unpaid deduction, use the daily wage configured in Unpaid Leave Policy settings (Divide by 30.42 custom days, not calendar days). Calculate daily wage by dividing monthly salary by 30.42, then multiply by number of unpaid leave days

troubleshooting.group_description: When encountering discrepancies in daily wage calculator remarks, users should verify the actual deduction amount to confirm calculation accuracy.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check the actual calculated deduction amount, which remains correct despite potential remarks display issues.

glossary.definition: Calculated by dividing total monthly salary by 30.41 to determine daily wage rate
A proportional salary calculation for partial periods, typically calculated by dividing total salary by 30 days and multiplying by days worked
Calculated by dividing basic monthly salary by a fixed 30-day divisor, representing the per-day compensation value used in gratuity and leave calculations
End of service benefit computation based on years worked, daily wage rate, and service duration, using a fixed formula of 21 days per year for service between 1-5 years
Method of calculating salary for days an employee is on leave, typically prorated based on total monthly salary and days of leave.
Days counted for salary proration, which can be configured differently per work week and may include all 7 days of the week
A fixed number (30.42) used to calculate the daily wage by dividing monthly salary, used in unpaid leave deduction calculations instead of using exact calendar days
A calculation method where daily wage is prorated based on the number of calendar days in a month, with deductions applied for days not worked.
The total number of days in a specific month, which can vary (e.g., 28/29 days in February, 30 or 31 days in other months).

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage remarks display
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculator remarks field shows a daily rate calculation reference, but may not always accurately reflect the correct number of calendar days.
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Payroll → Daily Wage Calculator → Unpaid Leave Deduction Section
steps: Check remarks field for daily rate calculation
expected: Remarks field contains a daily rate calculation reference

claims_to_validate.title: salary configuration dependency
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deduction calculations depend on existing salary configuration at time of leave request creation
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Payroll → Leave Management → Unpaid Leave Deduction
indicators: Deduction amount tied to salary config
expected: Deduction reflects salary configuration at request creation
selector_hints: Deduction amount tied to salary config

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage formula read only
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation formula is displayed as read-only and cannot be edited by users
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Payroll Settings → Compensation → Daily Wage Configuration

claims_to_validate.title: leave encashment calculation method
claims_to_validate.statement: When configuring leave encashment, users can select between 'working days' and 'custom days' calculation methods
claims_to_validate.suggested_path: Daily Wage Calculator → Leave Encashment Settings
expected: Both options 'working days' and 'custom days' are available

claims_to_validate.title: work week configuration navigation
claims_to_validate.statement: Users can access work week configuration to view and verify working days setup

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage divisor configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage divisor is configured at policy level and cannot be overridden at individual employee level
expected: No option to change divisor per individual employee

claims_to_validate.title: daily wage calculation configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using basic salary plus allowance divided by working days for an employee
expected: Daily wage calculation method is configurable at policy level
